abstract: 2 CD-ROMs broken into seven subject strands: Mer (An insight into the history and culture of the Meriam people who live on the island of Mer, Eddie Mabo's birthplace)--The Man (A biography of Eddie Mabo)--The Case (a history of the Mabo case)--Mabo (An edited and updated version of the documentary "Land Bilong Islanders" (1989, 35 min.)--Native Title (An exploration of the common law principle of native title)--Land rights (A history of the land rights struggle by Indigenous Australians)--Terra Nullius (an investigation into this centuries-old legal principle that justified colonial occupation of Australia)
description: An extensive multimedia resource that explores a pivotal moment in Australian history--the landmark Mabo legal case in which the High Court acknowledged the claim of Aboriginal Australians to native title. Combining 2 CD ROM's with a website and online database, the project brings together a documentary video with hundreds of specially created audio-visual sequences and a wealth of text and images covering issues from colonisation and indigenous culture to land rights and native title. Suitable for senior secondary, undergraduate and research at adult levels. A website has been created as part of this project containing updates, additional material, technical information and links to other related sites. Available online at www.MaboNativeTitle.com Study notes and related material can be printed from the Film Australia website at http://www.filmast.com.au  SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: PC: Multimedia capable machines/Operating System: All Windows 32 bit operating systems/Memory: 16 mb free RAM - 20 mb physical RAM a minimum/CD-ROM Drive: 4 speed/Display: 640 x 480 pixels in 16 bit (thousands of colours).
